net.ligreto.builders
Interface TargetInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
ExcelReportTarget, ExcelStreamReportTarget, ReportTarget
public interface TargetInterface

Provides the interface to dump the data to the particular part of the report. The entire design is driven as the output is written into spreadsheet. All other implementations for report types have to adopt this approach.

The output is driven by the output rows. Within each row the multiple cell values could be dumped. Each cell that is dumped has the position within the row (like column number within spreadsheet).

The sample pseudo-code working with the target: 

 BuiderInterface bi = ReportBuilder.createInstance(...);
 TargetInterface ti = bi.getTargetBuilder(...);
 
 while (rows to be dumped exist) {
     ti.nextRow();
     ti.dumpCell(0, value1);
     ti.dumpCell(1, value2);
     ti.shiftPosition(2, 1);
     ti.dumpCell(0, value3);
     ri.dumpCell(1, value4);
 }
This interface have to be implemented to provide various types of reports, e.g. XML, CSV, database table output.

Author:
Julius Stroffek

Method Detail

nextRow

void nextRow()
             throws java.io.IOException
Move the output to the next row.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was I/O error

setPosition

void setPosition(int baseColumnPosition)
Sets up the output cell position within the current row.

Parameters:
baseColumnPosition - the cell position to set

setPosition

void setPosition(int baseColumnPosition,
                 int columnStep)
Sets up the output cell position within the current row. This method could be used to arrange the dump of values to be interlaced. This could be achieved by setting up the columnsStep to value larger than 1.

Parameters:
baseColumnPosition - the cell position to set
columnStep - the step to shift for each cell on the position larger than 0
See Also:
dumpCell(int, Object)

shiftPosition

void shiftPosition(int columnsToShift)
Shifts the output cell position from the current position by the specified number of cells.

Parameters:
columnsToShift - the number of cells to shift

shiftPosition

void shiftPosition(int columnsToShift,
                   int columnStep)
Shifts the output cell position from the current position by the specified number of cells. This method could be used to arrange the dump of values to be interlaced. This could be achieved by setting up the columnsStep to value larger than 1.

Parameters:
columnsToShift - the number of cells to shift
columnStep - the step to shift for each cell on the position larger than 0

dumpCell

void dumpCell(int index,
              java.lang.Object value)
              throws LigretoException
Dump the specified object to the position shifted by the specified index. The position is adjusted by the step specified in the call to setPosition(int, int) or shiftPosition(int, int) and multiplied by the value of parameter index.

Parameters:
index - the index of the output cell measured by the actual possition in the current row
value - the value to be dumped
Throws:
LigretoException - if there was processing error
See Also:
setPosition(int, int), shiftPosition(int, int)
